meanings.definition: A person who adheres to or advocates neoclassicism in art, literature, architecture, etc.
meanings.sent1: The neoclassicist studied ancient Greek sculptures to improve their own artwork.
meanings.sent2: The museum featured an exhibition showcasing the works of a renowned neoclassicist.
meanings.sent3: The neoclassicist tried to paint a modern cityscape in the style of ancient Rome, creating a unique blend of eras.
meanings.sent4: Her writing was like a neoclassicist's sculpture, carefully chiseled and structured.
meanings.sent5: The neoclassicist's dedication to traditional forms inspired many young artists to explore classical techniques.

meanings.sent1: The neoclassicist architecture of the building stood out among the modern skyscrapers.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the neoclassicist elements in the new interior design of the library.
meanings.sent3: The neoclassicist touch to the garden gave it a timeless and elegant feel.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a neoclassicist structure, with clear references to ancient philosophies.
meanings.sent5: The neoclassicist style of the painting emphasized symmetry and balance, creating a harmonious composition.
